author: Telegraph Reporters
title: 'Out of control' police officer who slammed man's head against a wall narrowly avoids jail
text:
A Metropolitan Police officer has been fined after slamming a man's head against a wall and attempting to headbutt him during an arrest, Scotland Yard said.
PC Gareth Knight, 38, assaulted the man in Brixton, south London, on January 30 as he was arrested on suspicion of possessing drugs.
The officer, who is attached to the London Borough of Lambeth, was found guilty of common assault and causing actual bodily harm at Southwark Crown Court on Wednesday.
Gareth Knight Credit: Central News H e was handed a three-month suspended sentence and ordered to pay £500 in compensation, £500 in costs and serve 150 hours of unpaid community work during a hearing on Friday.
Mr Knight, who had been placed on restricted duties, was suspended following his conviction and a misconduct review will now take place, the Metropolitan Police said.
Detective Chief Superintendent Matt Gardner said: "It is the responsibility of all police officers to conduct themselves in a manner that meets the high standards of what the public and the organisation expect of them.
"The actions of PC Knight lets down all his colleagues, who work hard day and night to protect Londoners and catch criminals.
"PC Knight's supervisors spoke out - officers do not tolerate wrongdoing from those people who work alongside."
